It is a common misconception that liberals confuse anti-homosexuality with anti-homosexual. The two words are fundamentally linked, of course, but are not equivalents, at least as far as I've understood the issue. Because of this, most homosexuals disregard conservatives who are against homosexuality as "anti-gay, anti-liberal traditionalists". Of course, many conservatives (and I assure you, many liberals too) are anti-homosexual-groups such as "God Hates Fags" are considered the general belief of most conservatives, when in reality that is simply not the case. Most conservatives are indifferent about the issue, most of them culturally accept it, like many liberals.
 
 To prove my point, I shall compare two separate dialogues with a liberal and conservative. The liberal, a 20-year-old Sophmore at San Francisco State University, said that gay marriage was a right, as homosexuals have done nothing wrong. I asked her two questions. My first question was "What do you think the conservative view is?", her response was that "homosexuals are sinners and are destined for hell". The second question was "Have you ever thought that maybe homosexuals are doing something wrong?" and she immediately was irritated that I asked such a "radical" question and said "Of course they aren't doing anything wrong. Nothing more wrong than when two people fall in love; when two people get married... it's the same". The second interview was with a conservative resident of San Jose, California. When I asked him what he thought about homosexuality, he said it was a "disgusting perversion... gay marriage should be outlawed", and when I asked him why he said "because it's immoral... it hurts society". However, he wasn't able explain why it hurt society. I have also had many dialogues with conservatives and liberals alike, and they all come up with similar answers, occasionally being debatable. The truth of the matter is most liberals and conservatives don't actually understand the issue, and people like "God Hates Fags" are one of these. 
 
 What is the true conservative belief? The conservative belief is such: "We don't hate homosexuals; we find homosexuality a damaging act". The belief is that homosexuality is essentially a disorder, and is against nature to commit the act. Allow me to distinguish this from one who is "anti-homosexual". An "Anti-homosexual" is essentially a "homophobe", in the sense that he is either afraid or hateful of homosexuals. Remarkably, there are fewer of these than we realize. Liberals often misuse the definition on conservatives who are against gay marriage or sodomy. The truth of the matter is that many of these people, specifically more prominent conservatives, do not fall into the category of homophobia. 
 
 Just my two cents.

 Given the bathhouses of the 80s, I wouldn't be surprised at the number of partners. However, things have changed. There are lots of monogamous people now. There aren't bathhouse-psychos anymore. Also, people would just find a "quicky" because they *couldn't* be monogamous without ridicule. They had to hide behind their wives and act straight by day.
 
 
 Most gays answered between 101-500 partners. This is ridiculously high. 

 Given the no-interviewing-minors thing...they probably interviewed old people from the 70s/80s that did stupid stuff--not educated people who knew better than to do that and who are more comfortable with themselves
 
According to International Journal of Epidemiology, the average homosexual's life expectance at age 20 is 20 years less than heterosexual men. 

 As society changes to allow gay people to lead normal lives instead of forcing them to distance themselves and try to escape reality, this gap decreases. If you just let them be themselves and people stop hating, they will have no reason to prefer illusion to reality because reality will not be bad to them. So, be nice and they'll live just as long and have happy, normal lives. Or do you like when people die young?
 
 
Finally, according to the CDC, 64% of AIDS victims got AIDS because of gay activity.

 And when did they get HIV? See, thanks to technological advances, many people more recently infected don't get AIDS and just live with HIV. If someone has full-blown AIDS, they likely were infected quite a while ago. Possibly back when being gay was *really* taboo and they had random partners because they didn't want their wives to know blah blah blah
 
Is that evidence enough that homosexuality is disordered?

 You used that as an adjective to modify....what? Ignoring the odd grammar, that doesn't make being gay a disorder. It means that society is giving gay people problems that they didn't have to begin with.
JustineCredible

It is a common misconception that liberals confuse anti-homosexuality with anti-homosexual. The two words are fundamentally linked, of course, but are not equivalents, at least as far as I've understood the issue.

 
 As true as this may be, the practice of the difference here is not universally known or utilized. Just as those who say they are against drugs take their frustrations out upon drug users, so to do those who are "against" homosexuality take their frustrations out against homosexuals. We've seen this in practice time and time again. From senceless murders of innocent gays and lesbians to governmental restrictions of full human equality towards homosexuals. 
 
 
Because of this, most homosexuals disregard conservatives who are against homosexuality as "anti-gay, anti-liberal traditionalists". Of course, many conservatives (and I assure you, many liberals too) are anti-homosexual-groups such as "God Hates Fags" are considered the general belief of most conservatives, when in reality that is simply not the case.

 
 The problem is that even if what you say is actually the case, those who actually have a real impact on homosexuals and their lives are the ones who influence the idea that said concervatives are all "out to get" homosexuals. 
 Maybe a bit of introspective thought by law makers and religious leaders is necessary here.
 
 
Most conservatives are indifferent about the issue, most of them culturally accept it, like many liberals.

 
 With the obvious exception of yourself, for if you truly were/are so indifferent you wouldn't be commenting here.
 
 
 
To prove my point, I shall compare two separate dialogues with a liberal and conservative. The liberal, a 20-year-old Sophmore at San Francisco State University, said that gay marriage was a right, as homosexuals have done nothing wrong. I asked her two questions. My first question was "What do you think the conservative view is?", her response was that "homosexuals are sinners and are destined for hell". The second question was "Have you ever thought that maybe homosexuals are doing something wrong?" and she immediately was irritated that I asked such a "radical" question and said "Of course they aren't doing anything wrong. Nothing more wrong than when two people fall in love; when two people get married... it's the same". The second interview was with a conservative resident of San Jose, California. When I asked him what he thought about homosexuality, he said it was a "disgusting perversion... gay marriage should be outlawed", and when I asked him why he said "because it's immoral... it hurts society". However, he wasn't able explain why it hurt society. I have also had many dialogues with conservatives and liberals alike, and they all come up with similar answers, occasionally being debatable. The truth of the matter is most liberals and conservatives don't actually understand the issue, and people like "God Hates Fags" are one of these.

 
 You seem to have a keen interest in the most extremist of ultra-concervative hate groups here. 
 My question to you is this: 
 Do you believe in God? 
 
 If your responce is positive then I must also ask:
 
 Do you believe your God to be a loving God? 
 
 Again, if your responce is positive I must continue: 
 
 If you believe your God to be a loving God, do you also believe He loves all his "children" equally and uncondonditionally as a "parent" would? 
 
 Once more if your responce is postive I'll ask one more: 
 
 If you believe your God to be a loving, bennevolent God, loving His children unconditionally as a parent, then why would this same God create an entire portion of his children just to be hated, beaten, ruled against and even murdered? 
 
 I'd love to read your responces to these questions.
 
 
 
What is the true conservative belief? The conservative belief is such: "We don't hate homosexuals; we find homosexuality a damaging act". 

 
 Well, since you've taken it upon yourself to speak for the entire concervative population, I must ask: How is homosexuality damaging? Damaging to whom, to what, in what way? 
 
 
The belief is that homosexuality is essentially a disorder, and is against nature to commit the act.

 
 How is it a disorder when every reputable mental health group agrees it is not? Homosexuality has been removed from the APA list of disorders. Don't try to argue the why or how, the fact remains that no matter what the motivation was at the time to remove homosexuality from this list it remains "off the books" as a disorder to this day, thirty years later. 
 
 If it is so "against nature" then explain why other species of animals have been documented as developing long lasting homosexual relationships as well? If it's so "against nature" they why hasn't homosexuality been "bred out" of society yet? Wouldn't it go "against nature" for this "disorder" to survive? 
 
 
 
 Allow me to distinguish this from one who is "anti-homosexual". An "Anti-homosexual" is essentially a "homophobe", in the sense that he is either afraid or hateful of homosexuals. Remarkably, there are fewer of these than we realize. Liberals often misuse the definition on conservatives who are against gay marriage or sodomy.

 
 Let us set the record straight here. (no pun intended) Sodomy doesn't mean homosexual anal sex, it mean anal sex on a much more generalized playing field. The real truth is that many heterosexuals not only practice sodomy with their opposite gender partners, but more and more teenage girls are "opting" for anal and oral sex than ever before. The blame here lies in the push to restrict real world safe sex education in schools. 
 
 
 The truth of the matter is that many of these people, specifically more prominent conservatives, do not fall into the category of homophobia. 

 
 This comment is an absolute lie. It's the "prominent" concervatives which are giving the soft-spoken and even accepting concervatives a bad reputation.
 Pat Robertson, President Bush, Governor Schwartzenager, Senator Santorum, and all the law makers and religious leaders who have either spoken out against gay marriage, gay employment equality and gay adoption...inclusive. 
 
 
 
Just my two cents.

 
 Which is about all this post has been worth.
Matthew S
